translation.en: [man] Sure, there are mutants and mages galore,
translation.zh: ‎当然有许多变种人和术士

translation.en: but the slow, beating heart of The Witcher is in its monsters.
translation.zh: ‎但是《猎魔人》的核心是怪物

translation.en: While some may be unfamiliar to you,
translation.zh: ‎有一些 你们也许并不熟悉

translation.en: they've actually been with us, stalking through human stories,
translation.zh: ‎它们其实和我们在一起 ‎在人类历史中潜行了数百年

translation.en: for centuries, even millennia.
translation.zh: ‎在人类历史中潜行了数百年 ‎甚至上千年

translation.en: Here are the very real mythologies behind every single monster in the first half of The Witcher's first season,
translation.zh:
‎以下是《猎魔人》第一季前半季
‎每一个怪物背后的神话故事

translation.en: in order of appearance.
translation.zh: ‎按出现顺序进行介绍

translation.en: Okay, so you know The Witcher is serious about monsters
translation.zh: ‎《猎魔人》很重视怪物

translation.en: when it has a kikimora in the first scene of the first episode.
translation.zh: ‎第一集第一场镜头中就出现了奇奇摩

translation.en: If that name's not ringing a bell,
translation.zh: ‎如果你对这个名字没印象

translation.en: it's probably because it's a beast from Slavic folklore,
translation.zh:
‎大概是因为
‎这是斯拉夫民俗传说中的野兽

translation.en: which has been underrepresented in popular fiction.
translation.zh: ‎在流行小说中较少出现

translation.en: To start, kikimoras are always female.
translation.zh:
‎首先 奇奇摩总是雌性 ‎它们产生于
‎死胎或者难产而死的妇人

translation.en: They rise from stillborn children, or women who died in labor,
translation.zh:
‎它们产生于
‎死胎或者难产而死的妇人

translation.en: and often bear the deceased's face.
translation.zh: ‎通常会长着死者的脸

translation.en: In some Russian versions of the tale,
translation.zh: ‎在某些俄国版本的传说中

translation.en: kikimora is, indeed, a creature of the swamp,
translation.zh: ‎奇奇摩是沼泽生物

translation.en: who leaves wet footprints wherever she goes.
translation.zh: ‎去哪里都会留下潮湿的脚印

translation.en: But in most, she's a purely household spirit,
translation.zh: ‎但在多数情况下 它是家中鬼魂

translation.en: occasionally, a nightmarish household spirit,
translation.zh: ‎有时是噩梦般的家中鬼魂

translation.en: slipping through keyholes to squat on the chest of sleepers, suffocating them.
translation.zh:
‎从锁眼中钻出
‎蹲坐在睡梦中人的胸口 ‎令其窒息

translation.en: In her more benign incarnations, though,
translation.zh: ‎不过在它较为良性的化身中

translation.en: she's described as more of a nuisance with a cleanliness fetish.
translation.zh: ‎它被描述为有洁癖的小妖怪

translation.en: So you can think of kikimora as kind of a monstrous cousin to… Marie Kondo?
translation.zh:
‎所以你可以把奇奇摩
‎看作近藤麻理惠的怪物表姐

translation.en: I love mess.
translation.zh: ‎我很喜欢乱糟糟

translation.en: Human-animal hybrids are a…
translation.zh: ‎人兽混血

translation.en: ♪ Tale as old as time ♪
translation.zh: ‎是与时间一样古老的传说

translation.en: Almost every mythological tradition on Earth has some variation of them.
translation.zh:
‎地球上几乎所有的神话传统
‎都有各自的版本

translation.en: The first we see in The Witcher are sylvans,
translation.zh:
‎在《猎魔人》中
‎我们看到的第一个就是森林精灵

translation.en: which resemble fawns,
translation.zh: ‎与幼鹿相仿

translation.en: the unpredictable woodland man-goats from Greco-Roman mythology.
translation.zh:
‎它是希腊罗马神话故事中
‎不可预测的林地人羊

translation.en: In many versions of that latter myth, the Minotaur was conceived
translation.zh: ‎在这个神话的许多版本中 ‎牛头人的诞生

translation.en: when the insulted god Poseidon took revenge on the insulting King Minos
translation.zh:
‎是因为受到羞辱的海神波塞顿
‎向米诺斯王复仇

translation.en: by cursing his wife,
translation.zh: ‎诅咒他的妻子

translation.en: making her fall for a real specimen of a bull.
translation.zh: ‎让她爱上一头公牛

translation.en: There's a lot of art on the Internet about this. [sighs]
translation.zh: ‎网上有许多这方面的艺术作品

translation.en: It might be why Geralt goes immediately for the mom insults.
translation.zh:
‎杰洛特当即就侮辱它母亲
‎也许是因为这个原因

translation.en: Your mother fuck a goat?
translation.zh: ‎你妈操了一头羊？

translation.en: But lest you think that human-animal hybrids are just ancient magical things,
translation.zh:
‎但为免你以为
‎人兽混血只是古代魔幻

translation.en: allow me to introduce you to the mysterious Pig-Faced Lady of Europe.
translation.zh: ‎请允许我向你介绍神秘的欧洲猪脸女

translation.en: Nearly simultaneously in the 1600s, in multiple places across the continent,
translation.zh:
‎在16世纪
‎欧洲大陆多处几乎同时兴起一个传说

translation.en: a legend arose of a pregnant rich woman who was cursed,
translation.zh:
‎在16世纪
‎欧洲大陆多处几乎同时兴起一个传说 ‎一位富家孕妇遭到诅咒

translation.en: and whose baby was born with a pig's head.
translation.zh: ‎她生下的孩子长着一只猪头

translation.en: The myth persisted, and somehow gained the veneer of fact.
translation.zh:
‎这个故事经久不衰
‎似乎还得到了一些事实的支撑

translation.en: As late as the 1800s, newspapers reported
translation.zh: ‎到了18世纪 报纸报道

translation.en: that the Pig-Faced Lady lived in London's posh Manchester Square.
translation.zh: ‎猪脸女住在伦敦高档的曼彻斯特广场

translation.en: If you finished The Witcher,
translation.zh: ‎如果你看完《猎魔人》

translation.en: you know the striga is probably the scariest monster on the show,
translation.zh:
‎你会知道吸血妖鸟
‎大概是本片最恐怖的怪物

translation.en: although technically, she's a cursed human.
translation.zh:
‎虽然严格地说
‎吸血妖鸟是受到诅咒的人类

translation.en: And that's fitting, because they're pretty terrifying
translation.zh:
‎这是符合的 ‎因为传说虽然不多
‎但它们确实很恐怖

translation.en: in the scant myths about them too.
translation.zh:
‎因为传说虽然不多
‎但它们确实很恐怖

translation.en: According to what we have, the striga is sort of a vampire prototype.
translation.zh: ‎根据我们查到的材料 ‎吸血妖鸟可以说是吸血鬼的原型

translation.en: Huge, almost bird-like claws, sharp fangs, and a thirst for human flesh and blood,
translation.zh:
‎有巨大的鸟爪、锋利的獠牙
‎嗜人肉和人血

translation.en: -although she can live off of animals too. -[wailing]
translation.zh: ‎不过它也可以以动物为食

translation.en: But strigas weren't born that way.
translation.zh: ‎但吸血妖鸟并非生来如此

translation.en: The unlucky number was two.
translation.zh: ‎不幸数字是二

translation.en: People with two hearts, two souls, two sets of teeth,
translation.zh:
‎有两颗心脏、两个灵魂
‎两副牙齿的人

translation.en: conditions common when a pregnant woman was cursed,
translation.zh: ‎这种情况在怀孕女性身上很常见

translation.en: could become strigas after they died.
translation.zh:
‎当她们被诅咒时
‎可能在死后变为吸血妖鸟

translation.en: Their second self sort of took over the corpse
translation.zh: ‎它们的第二自我霸占尸体

translation.en: and went on a feeding frenzy.
translation.zh: ‎开始疯狂进食

translation.en: Even though they're not so common in fiction,
translation.zh: ‎即便它们在小说中并不常见

translation.en: it's interesting how many cultures have variations on the theme.
translation.zh:
‎许多文化中
‎还是有不少关于该主题的各种叙述

translation.en: Striga's demonic cousins proliferated across Southern and Eastern Europe
translation.zh:
‎吸血妖鸟的魔鬼亲戚
‎在东欧和南欧激增

translation.en: to unlikely places, like your garden.
translation.zh:
‎出现在了不太可能出现的地方
‎比如你的花园

translation.en: This is the striga, or witchweed plant, which is kind of pretty, right?
translation.zh: ‎这种花就叫吸血妖鸟 也叫巫婆草 ‎挺美的 对吧？

translation.en: But it's known for viciously penetrating the roots of a host plant
translation.zh: ‎但它会恶毒地侵入宿主植物的根部

translation.en: and sucking out all of its nutrients.
translation.zh: ‎吸走其全部养分

translation.en: Scientists even make dad jokes about its rapaciousness.
translation.zh:
‎科学家甚至还就其贪婪
‎大讲老套笑话

translation.en: So whether it's the plant or the bewitched princess variety,
translation.zh: ‎所以不论是植物还是着魔的公主

translation.en: -stay away from strigas, y'all. -[squealing]
translation.zh: ‎都请大家远离吸血妖鸟

translation.en: Well, when it comes to episode four's selkiemaw,
translation.zh: ‎关于第四集的瑟奇海魔

translation.en: the showrunners of The Witcher didn't give us much info to work with.
translation.zh:
‎《猎魔人》的节目统筹
‎没有给我们提供多少信息

translation.en: Thanks, Lauren Schmidt Hissrich!
translation.zh: ‎谢谢 劳伦·施密特·希斯里奇！

translation.en: All we hear is a pretty gripping tavern talk
translation.zh: ‎我们只听到在激烈的酒馆对话中

translation.en: from a villager that includes the creature's name.
translation.zh: ‎一位村民提到了这种生物的名字

translation.en: The ice cracked open
translation.zh: ‎冰裂开了

translation.en: and a selkiemaw shot out!
translation.zh: ‎一只瑟奇海魔窜出来！

translation.en: Oh, you never seen one!
translation.zh: ‎你们从来没见过！

translation.en: And all we see are its guts on Geralt.
translation.zh: ‎我们只看见它的内脏在杰洛特身上

translation.en: Had to kill it from the inside.
translation.zh: ‎只能从它肚子里下手

translation.en: The name "selkiemaw" in every spelling we could think of
translation.zh: ‎我们搜索“瑟奇海魔“

translation.en: doesn't return any results.
translation.zh: ‎搜不到任何结果

translation.en: But plain old selkies are indeed notable mythological creatures of the water.
translation.zh: ‎但瑟奇确实是神话中著名的水怪

translation.en: In Irish, Scottish, and Icelandic folklore,
translation.zh: ‎在爱尔兰、苏格兰、冰岛民俗传说中

translation.en: the selkie is kind of an affable, shape-shifting seal.
translation.zh: ‎瑟奇是和蔼可亲的变形海豹

translation.en: It mostly spends its time in seal-like endeavors,
translation.zh: ‎多数时间都像海豹那样

translation.en: lounging on rocks, being cute, et cetera,
translation.zh: ‎在岩石上休息 很可爱的样子

translation.en: but occasionally, it sheds its prized skin,
translation.zh: ‎但有时它会褪下珍贵的皮

translation.en: revealing a beautiful human underneath, and comes ashore.
translation.zh: ‎展现出皮下美丽的人形 来到岸上

translation.en: There's usually a lot of marriage shenanigans after this.
translation.zh: ‎之后通常会有许多婚姻恶作剧

translation.en: Its use is fitting for an episode writen by an Irishman.
translation.zh:
‎它的出现与爱尔兰人写的这一集
‎非常契合

translation.en: Still, a friendly seal with magical outerwear
translation.zh: ‎但是披着魔法外衣的友好海豹

translation.en: doesn't quite square with what little we know of the selkiemaw.
translation.zh:
‎并不能与我们所知的瑟奇海魔
‎划上等号 ‎比如它能把一个猎魔人整个吞掉

translation.en: Like, it can swallow a witcher whole.
translation.zh: ‎比如它能把一个猎魔人整个吞掉

translation.en: It has swallowed a whole village… whole.
translation.zh: ‎它还曾将整个村庄吞掉

translation.en: It possesses a cavernous mouth with devil's teeth.
translation.zh: ‎它有巨大的嘴巴和魔鬼的牙齿

translation.en: And actually, there is tell of a similar creature
translation.zh: ‎其实据说有类似的生物

translation.en: lurking deep within Russia,
translation.zh: ‎隐藏在俄罗斯境内深处

translation.en: about a six hours' drive west of Moscow.
translation.zh: ‎离莫斯科大概有六小时车程

translation.en: The Brosno Dragon.
translation.zh: ‎布罗斯诺龙

translation.en: It's said to be a huge reptilian or dinosaur-like creature
translation.zh:
‎据说它是巨大的爬行动物
‎或是像恐龙那样的生物

translation.en: that inhabits the small, but curiously deep waters of Lake Brosno.
translation.zh: ‎居住在小而深的布罗斯诺湖水之中

translation.en: And just like the selkiemaw, the dragon can eat.
translation.zh: ‎与瑟奇海魔一样 龙胃口很大

translation.en: His stories are full of him chomping down on things
translation.zh:
‎有许多关于它
‎大口咀嚼各种东西的故事

translation.en: like invading Tatar warriors and their horses,
translation.zh: ‎比如吃掉来犯的鞑靼战士和战马

translation.en: a German aeroplane during World War II,
translation.zh: ‎吃掉二战中的一架德军飞机

translation.en: and, somehow, an entire island that some Vikings were going to leave some treasure on.
translation.zh:
‎甚至吃掉了
‎维京人要留下宝藏的一整个岛屿

translation.en: I don't know if this is wise without a witcher in tow,
translation.zh: ‎不带上猎魔人就去 不知是否明智

translation.en: but people still look for the dragon.
translation.zh: ‎但还是有人在寻找龙

translation.en: This is an easily-chompable dog sled team searching across the frozen lake.
translation.zh:
‎这个狗拉雪橇队在冰湖上搜寻
‎很容易就能被它吃掉

translation.en: ♪ Toss a coin to your witcher ♪
translation.zh: ‎付钱给猎魔人

translation.en: ♪ O, Valley of Plenty ♪
translation.zh: ‎丰饶之谷

translation.en: Our search for the selkiemaw, however, has reached its successful conclusion.
translation.zh:
‎然而我们对瑟奇海魔的搜索
‎成功地得到了结论

translation.en: We figured it out.
translation.zh: ‎我们弄清楚了

translation.en: Take that, Lauren Schmidt Hissrich!
translation.zh: ‎你听好了 劳伦·施密特·希斯里奇

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: ‎谢谢

translation.en: In the fourth episode,
translation.zh: ‎在第四集中

translation.en: there's also this formidable killer insect that haunts Yennefer, roachhound.
translation.zh:
‎强大的杀人昆虫追着叶妮芙不放
‎那就是蟑螂猎狗

translation.en: So we started researching it, and the weirdest thing we realized is…
translation.zh: ‎于是我们开始研究它 ‎我们发现的最奇怪的一件事是

translation.en: where are all the insect monsters?
translation.zh: ‎昆虫怪物都上哪儿去了？

translation.en: Like, I mean, insects, and all arthropods, really,
translation.zh: ‎昆虫和所有节肢动物

translation.en: are basically already monsters in real life.
translation.zh: ‎在现实生活中几乎都已经是怪物了

translation.en: So why not make them mythological ones?
translation.zh:
‎为什么不在神话中
‎将其描绘为怪物呢？

translation.en: But maybe we're not looking in the right places.
translation.zh: ‎但也许是因为我们没找对地方

translation.en: Think about it.
translation.zh: ‎想想看

translation.en: The typical Western myths that many of us learn in school
translation.zh:
‎我们许多人
‎在学校学到的典型西方神话中

translation.en: usually involve mammalian or sometimes lizard-like creatures.
translation.zh: ‎通常有哺乳类或者长得像蜥蜴的生物

translation.en: But Asian, Pacific, and Indigenous folklore
translation.zh:
‎但是亚洲、太平洋
‎以及原住民民俗传说中

translation.en: often seems to use insects and spiders in their monster making.
translation.zh: ‎通常将昆虫和蜘蛛当作怪物

translation.en: In the tales of Thailand and several New York State Native American tribes,
translation.zh:
‎在泰国以及
‎纽约州几个原住民部落的传说中

translation.en: there are monster mosquitoes as big as chickens
translation.zh: ‎有像鸡那么大的蚊子怪物

translation.en: who are capable of launching coordinated attacks on forts.
translation.zh: ‎能够对要塞实施联合攻击

translation.en: The Wayana of South America have Kuluwajak,
translation.zh: ‎南美的圭亚那有库鲁瓦贾克

translation.en: forgive the pronunciation,
translation.zh: ‎我的发音请见谅

translation.en: a two-headed caterpillar who cuts off and devours human heads.
translation.zh: ‎会将人头切下并吃掉的双头毛虫

translation.en: And then there's Japan.
translation.zh: ‎还有日本

translation.en: The Japanese have a giant Samurai-hating spider
translation.zh: ‎日本有仇恨武士的巨型蜘蛛

translation.en: that can turn invisible,
translation.zh: ‎会隐身

translation.en: and Ōmukade, a mountain-sized centipede with venom for breath.
translation.zh:
‎名叫“大百足” 像山那么大的蜈蚣
‎能喷出毒气

translation.en: By the way, this is a real Mukade centipede,
translation.zh: ‎对了 这是一只真的蜈蚣

translation.en: and I still find it frightening.
translation.zh: ‎我觉得它都已经很吓人了

translation.en: So, yeah, insect monsters.
translation.zh: ‎所以没错 确实有昆虫怪物

translation.en: I'm not scared.
translation.zh: ‎我不害怕

translation.en: Are-- are you scared?
translation.zh: ‎你害怕吗？

translation.en: Run far, run fast, Yennefer!
translation.zh: ‎快跑 跑得远远的 叶妮芙

translation.en: [echoing] There's something profoundly disturbing about meeting your exact twin.
translation.zh:
‎与自己一模一样的双胞胎见面
‎确实让人心里打鼓

translation.en: -Wait. -Wait. -Stop that! -Stop that!
translation.zh: ‎等一下 别这样

translation.en: Which might be why the myth of the doppelgänger
translation.zh:
‎分身神话
‎总会出现在我们的流行小说中

translation.en: keeps finding its way into our popular fiction,
translation.zh: ‎也许就是因为这个原因

translation.en: including in The Witcher's doppler.
translation.zh: ‎包括《猎魔人》中的变形怪

translation.en: True, the word doppelgänger was only coined in the 18th century,
translation.zh: ‎没错 “分身“这个词在18世纪才出现

translation.en: but cultures as old as the Ancient Egyptians
translation.zh: ‎但是像古埃及这样古老的文化

translation.en: believed in the ka,
translation.zh: ‎相信“卡”

translation.en: a sort of spiritual facsimile
translation.zh: ‎类似于精神副本

translation.en: replete with a person's memories and feelings
translation.zh: ‎其中装满了一个人的记忆与感受

translation.en: that could sometimes mislead.
translation.zh: ‎有时能产生误导

translation.en: But they can also replace you.
translation.zh: ‎但它也可以取代你

translation.en: Everything you've ever done,
translation.zh: ‎你所做过的一切

translation.en: ever debated,
translation.zh: ‎说过的话

translation.en: ever dreamed is in our head now.
translation.zh: ‎梦到过的事 ‎现在都在我们的头脑中

translation.en: People from the Orkney Islands feared the trow,
translation.zh: ‎奥克尼群岛的人害怕“特劳”

translation.en: sickly changeling creatures that would replace healthy human babies with their identical trow replicas.
translation.zh:
‎这种生物会用一模一样的“特劳”替身
‎替换健康的人类婴儿

translation.en: Sometimes a benign version of the doppelgänger will pop up.
translation.zh: ‎有时候会有好的分身传说

translation.en: The Norse Vardøger, for instance, was an identical you
translation.zh:
‎比如挪威的瓦尔德格
‎是一模一样的你

translation.en: that went ahead of the real you and showed up early to all your meetings.
translation.zh:
‎但是走在真正的你前面
‎提前参加了你的所有会议

translation.en: But most of the time, they're an omen of doom.
translation.zh: ‎但多数时候 分身是毁灭的征兆

translation.en: Following his election in 1860,
translation.zh: ‎1860年当选之后

translation.en: Abraham Lincoln allegedly saw his exact double in the mirror.
translation.zh:
‎亚伯拉罕·林肯据说在镜子中
‎见到了一模一样的自己

translation.en: The other was pale and ghastly looking.
translation.zh: ‎另一个自己脸色苍白、面容可怕

translation.en: His wife believed the vision foretold his re-election,
translation.zh: ‎他的妻子相信这预示了他的连任

translation.en: but also his death.
translation.zh: ‎以及他的死亡

translation.en: There is a condition, heautoscopy,
translation.zh: ‎有一种病叫作离体自窥症

translation.en: which can cause someone to see their double at a distance.
translation.zh: ‎能引起人在远处看到自己的分身

translation.en: Or, at least, you better hope it's heautoscopy and not a doppelgänger!
translation.zh: ‎与其是分身 还不如是离体自窥症呢

translation.en: As hard as it is to believe while watching this,
translation.zh: ‎（栖息地：废墟、坟墓、沙漠） ‎看到这个的时候 很难相信

translation.en: the djinn of Arabian mythology are, surprisingly, a lot like us.
translation.zh:
‎阿拉伯神话中的灯神
‎居然和我们的很像

translation.en: I mean, sure, they are technically, according to the Koran, creatures made of smokeless fire
translation.zh:
‎没错 根据《古兰经》
‎严格地说灯神是无烟之火形成的生物

translation.en: that live in an unseeable, unknowable dimension somewhere beyond our own,
translation.zh: ‎住在我们之外不可见、不可知的维度

translation.en: and who are blessed with supernatural powers
translation.zh: ‎有超自然力

translation.en: of shape-shifting, invisibility and flight,
translation.zh: ‎会变形、隐身及打斗

translation.en: but they also possess a fair share of human qualities.
translation.zh: ‎但它也有不少的人类特性

translation.en: Like us, the djinn eat.
translation.zh: ‎像我们一样 灯神也要吃喝

translation.en: They drink. They sleep.
translation.zh: ‎像我们一样 灯神也要吃喝 ‎睡觉

translation.en: They fall in love or lust with each other and with humans,
translation.zh:
‎互相之间
‎或者与人类之间有爱慕或渴望

translation.en: as made vividly clear in this pre-Islamic era poem,
translation.zh:
‎就像这首前伊斯兰时代的诗
‎清楚描绘的

translation.en: which isn't all that flattering for either side.
translation.zh: ‎对双方都没什么好话

translation.en: And maybe most like us,
translation.zh: ‎最像我们的

translation.en: they're capable of choosing between good and evil,
translation.zh:
‎也许是他们有能力
‎在正邪之间作出选择

translation.en: although, unfortunately, many seem to end up on the dark side.
translation.zh:
‎不过很不幸
‎许多似乎最终站在了黑暗的一边

translation.en: Their mischief continues to the present day.
translation.zh: ‎今天它们的顽皮仍在继续

translation.en: Because while the existence of djinn predates even the founding of Islam,
translation.zh:
‎因为虽然灯神的存在
‎甚至要追溯到伊斯兰教创立之前

translation.en: belief in them is still very common in many parts of the Muslim world.
translation.zh:
‎在伊斯兰教世界的许多地方
‎仍有很多人相信灯神存在

translation.en: Djinn can be annoying.
translation.zh: ‎灯神有时候很烦人

translation.en: In 2009, a Saudi couple, somehow, sued one for harassment.
translation.zh:
‎2009年 一对沙特夫妇
‎以骚扰为由起诉一个灯神

translation.en: It was making weird noises and throwing rocks at their house.
translation.zh:
‎灯神发出很奇怪的噪音
‎并对他们家扔石头

translation.en: On the more serious side,
translation.zh: ‎在更严重的一方面

translation.en: the djinn are believed to be able to possess humans,
translation.zh: ‎据信灯神能附于人体

translation.en: and the psychiatric trauma attributed to djinn possession
translation.zh: ‎由灯神附体造成的精神创伤非常严重

translation.en: is so serious that I found seemingly dozens of articles
translation.zh: ‎我找到了关于这方面的几十篇文章

translation.en: and legitimate medical journals about it.
translation.zh: ‎以及合法的医学期刊

translation.en: By the way, if you are ever possessed,
translation.zh: ‎对了 如果你被附体

translation.en: Arabic lore suggests you go ahead and put on a necklace of fox or cat teeth
translation.zh:
‎阿拉伯传说建议你
‎戴上狐狸牙或者猫牙项链

translation.en: to frighten the djinn away.
translation.zh: ‎把灯神吓走

translation.en: But as with grumpy humans,
translation.zh: ‎但就像对待脾气暴躁的人类

translation.en: maybe the best advice is to just give the djinn their space
translation.zh: ‎也许最好的建议是给它们空间

translation.en: and never, ever go fishing for them.
translation.zh: ‎绝不要去捕它们

translation.en: Don't judge me.
translation.zh: ‎别小看我

translation.en: Okay, monster maniacs,
translation.zh: ‎好的 怪物狂人们

translation.en: those were all the monsters in the first half of The Witcher.
translation.zh:
‎这些是《猎魔人》前半部分
‎所有的怪物

translation.en: You may notice that Geralt spends a lot of time in bathtubs throughout the show,
translation.zh:
‎你也许注意到了
‎本片中杰洛特在浴缸里待了挺久

translation.en: which raised the question, are there bathtub monsters?
translation.zh: ‎那我们不禁要问 有浴缸怪物吗？

translation.en: Again, Japan comes through.
translation.zh: ‎又是日本

translation.en: The Akaname is a strange, dirty, and disgusting little goblin
translation.zh: ‎垢尝是奇怪、肮脏且恶心的小妖怪

translation.en: that licks the filth off of bathtubs.
translation.zh: ‎会舔食浴缸上的污垢

translation.en: So enjoy your bath tonight!
translation.zh: ‎今晚好好泡澡吧！
